name: Git Time Machine
description:
[WORK IN PROGRESS] This is a feature I always wanted on Github, so I decided to build it as a browser extension/external app.

It allows you to view the git history in the context of a single file. So you can view the entire file contents and go back through commits to visualize how it has changed.

The coolest thing about this app is that authenticated requests are made directly to the github API from the client (Backbone.js), without the need to go through my server. All requests are also cached in local storage, making for a really fast and responsive experience

name: Middle School Game Class
description: In January 2014 I taught a class of 10 middleschool students the basics of making games. We built the classic 'Flappy Bird' game using Game Salad, and then went on to make custom individual games from scratch for entry in the STEM compeition.

name: Wobble Wockets
description:
Addictive rocket game built with HTML5/Javascript/canvas using the phaser.io framework

Wobble Wockets works in all browsers (desktop and mobile) and has is in the process of being published on iOS/Android by a game studio.

Making this game is probably the most fun I've ever had programming!

name: Vim Snake
description:
Vim Snake is a quick and fun 1 day sprint project to explore HTML5 canvas. The game is built with canvas/javascript/jquery. I used sinatra for the backend and twitter for the login and leaderboard.

At the time of development, I was learning Vim and decided to use the same navigation controls for snake. The snake can only eat food in INSERT mode, and you cannot change direction until escaping INSERT mode

On August 16, Vim Snake made the front page of Hacker News which resulted in significant exposure and positive feedback.

name: HugeGif
description:
Created as the ultimate gif viewing experience.

The site is a reddit client built with backbone.js and is mobile friendly.

name: Theme Matcher
description:
ThemeMatcher.com is an online tool for designers, website owners, and bloggers that automatically creates a WordPress theme from an existing site.

I've learnt and actioned all the skills required to take a product from conception to profitability, including product design, project management, development, marketing, customer support, and much more.

name: Escape Plan
description:
I love to travel and dream of all the adventurous possibilities.

Escape Plan is a site for fellow daydreamers who fancy getting away as far away as possible.

The app uses the rome2rio API to work out how far away you can realistically get and also how to get there - complete with cost!

It was one of my early node/express projects and was good practice learning conventions and working with APIs.

name: Viaggio
description:
Meaning 'travel' in Italian, Viaggio is a Ruby on Rails web app that helps you showcase your favorite trips and adventures in a fun and immersive way. Photos are intelligently displayed on a map using the time and location metadata.

Built as a final project for Dev Bootcamp, I was responsible to for implementing OAuth, fetching and uploading photos using social media APIs, and setting up the rails application

name: Fitness Interval Trainer
description:
Workout timer for a popular 7 minute workout. The site was made with mobile in mind, and works great when added as a shortcut on your smart phone.

To ensure great mobile performace, no images or libraries (such as jQuery and bootstrap) were used.

I personally used this app daily for 6 months when I didnt have access to a gym

name: Faceoff
description:
This is a chrome extension I made to increase productivity by hiding your facebook news feed. This allows you to respond to messages and check notifications, without the distraction of the news feed.

Perfect for reducing time on facebook, without quitting cold turkey.

name: Command line Blackjack
description:
Game of 'command line blackjack' that supports multiple players, betting, doubling down, and splitting.

This ruby program is a demonstration of my coding ability and style. It was given to me as a coding challenge, and is complete with MVC style architecture and testing with rspec

name: Box Report
description:
Ever wondered what's taking up all that space in your Dropbox? Visualize and explore the contents of your Dropbox to easily find the files or folders taking up the most space.

I was responsible for the entire project. Site built with Sinatra. Authentication using Dropbox API. Graphs with Google Charts

The most interesting part of the project was getting the size of every folder, which involved recursively drilling into each folder and its contents to add up the total size.

name: Scanned Look
description:
Sinatra app that takes PDF or image files and manipulates them to appear printed/scanned.

It can handle multiple pages, and applies a blur, contrast, and random roataion. This project gave me good practice using system commands and also configuring nginx, unicorn and sinatra in a production environment.

name: Interview with Stephen
description:
Need a little interview practice? Brush up on your data structures and algorithms with our eerily lifelike Stephen Hawking simulator!

Result of a 9 hour hackathon where I was responsible for Rails setup and front end.
